entities.description: Respondents classified with a lifetime Major Depressive Episode (MDE)
Respondents classified with past year Major Depressive Episode if they reported a period of depression lasting 2 weeks or longer with other symptoms
Respondents with recurrent thoughts of death or recurrent suicide ideation
Symptoms associated with Major Depressive Episode
Sheehan Disability Scale measuring mental health-related impairment in four major life domains
Category indicating no interference with life activities, scored as 0
Category indicating mild impairment with life activities, scored as 1
Category indicating moderate impairment with life activities, scored as 2-4
Category indicating severe impairment with life activities, scored as 5-6
Category indicating very severe impairment with life activities, scored as 7 and above

relationships.description: Indicates that respondents with a lifetime MDE can also be classified with a past year MDE
Indicates that respondents with a lifetime MDE can also have recurrent thoughts of death or suicide ideation
Indicates the symptoms exhibited by respondents in the past year MDE
Youth SDS measures mental health-related impairment with no interference
Youth SDS measures mental health-related impairment with mild impairment
Youth SDS measures mental health-related impairment with moderate impairment
Youth SDS measures mental health-related impairment with severe impairment
Youth SDS measures mental health-related impairment with very severe impairment

triplets.subject: Respondents with Lifetime MDE
triplets.object: respondents with recurrent thoughts of death or recurrent suicide ideation
